head.title: Coronavirus (COVID-19) Updates – Coronavirus (COVID-19) Updates – Rowland Unified School District

meta.name: description
meta.content: Pre-K-12 and adult education district serves the communities of Rowland Heights, Walnut, La Puente, City of Industry and West Covina.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Rowland Unified School District, Rowland USD, Rowland Unified, Rowland School District, Rowland Schools

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: center; padding: 0px
margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: center; padding: 0px
margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: center; padding: 0px

span.strong: **STUDENT LEARNING: Please visit your school site for specific Student Learning Plans and Information that will take place remotely now through June 4.**

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px
margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px
margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px
margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px
margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px
margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px
margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px
p.span: The safety and health of our students, staff and community are the utmost importance and we are here to help our community during these unprecidented times of uncertainty.

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px
padding: 0px; margin: 0px
p.span: As you may be aware, for the health and safety of everyone and in an effort to slow the spread of COVID-19, today Governor Newsom and State Superintendent of Public Instruction Tony Thurmond announced the recommendation to continue student dismissal through the end of the school year. This recommendation is also supported by the Los Angeles County Office of Education.

p.style: padding: 0px; margin: 0px
padding: 0px; margin: 0px
p.span: While we are all still processing that our students will not physically be returning to our classrooms and schools, and come to accept that this school year will look like none other, our staff remains committed to providing support and services to our students and families.

p.style: padding: 0px; margin: 0px
padding: 0px; margin: 0px
p.span: Schools and learning will continue following Spring Break through June 4 in an online and remote setting. *Please visit your school's website for specific student remote learning information.

p.style: padding: 0px; margin: 0px
p.span: If your child needs a device to participate in online learning, please reach out to our technology hotline, at (626) 854-8543.
We will be providing further guidance on remote learning and information specific to the grade level of your child in the near future.

p.style: padding: 0px; margin: 0px
padding: 0px; margin: 0px
p.span: For our high school seniors, we know that this is not the conclusion of your senior year you had hoped for or any of us could have ever imagined. We are in the process of creating a survey to get your feedback on senior events and traditions before we make any decisions that will directly impact you.

p.style: padding: 0px; margin: 0px
padding: 0px; margin: 0px

strong.span: Again, want to remind you that we have support phone hotlines available that are open Monday – Friday, 8 AM – 4:30 PM:

p.style: padding: 0px; margin: 0px; text-align: center
padding: 0px; margin: 0px; text-align: center
padding: 0px; margin: 0px
padding: 0px; margin: 0px
p.span: Thank you for your continued support as we all work through this change together. Please know that we miss seeing our students in person and remain committed to supporting you and your child through this change to remote learning. Please continue to take care of yourself and your family by following and implementing social distancing practices and washing your hands frequently.

p.style: padding: 0px; margin: 0px
padding: 0px; margin: 0px
p.span: We will continue to be in touch and everyone looks forward to seeing students again through online learning.

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px
margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px

strong.span: We are still providing learning opportunities and providing valuable services to our children during the student dismissal. *Each school has posted learning information on their website.

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px
margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px
p.span: Free breakfast and lunch meals are provided for any children 18 and younger. These To-Go meals are now available twice a week, on Mondays and Thursdays, from 11 AM to 1 PM. Breakfast and lunch fore three days will be provided on Mondays, and on Thursday meals for Thursday and Friday are provided. *Please note children MUST be present to receive meals due to Federal Guidelines.

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px
margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px

strong.span: Meals To-Go Distribution Locations: Rowland High School, Nogales High School, Hollingworth Elementary, Hurley Elementary, Northam Elementary and Rowland Elementary.

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; background: white; padding: 0px
margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; background: white; padding: 0px

span.style: font-size: 14.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',serif; color: black

strong.span: Where can I find more information about COVID-19?

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 6pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px
p.span: You can find the latest information and additional resources on the following websites:

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 6pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px

a.span: Los Angeles County Department of Public Health

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 6pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px
margin: 0px 0px 6pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px

a.span: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 6pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px
margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px
line-height: normal; background: white; padding: 0px; margin: 0px
p.span: Once again, do not forget to follow these procedures to help prevent the spread of COVID-19:

li.span: Stay home when you are sick. Stay home for at least 72 hours after you no longer have a fever or symptoms of a fever without the use of fever-reducing medicines.
Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. If soap and water are not available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol.
Cover your coughs and sneezes with a tissue, and then dispose of the tissue and clean your hands immediately. If you do not have a tissue, use your sleeve (not your hands).
Limit close contact with people who are sick.

span.style: font-size: 14.0pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman',serif; color: black

li.span: Try to stay six feet away from other people.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces using a regular household cleaning spray or wipes.

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px

strong.span: The Superintendent's Office will continue to provide regular updates as they become available. Please see below for RUSD Parent Updates and Employee Updates section to the right.

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px
margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; line-height: normal; padding: 0px; text-align: center
margin: 0px 0px 0.0001pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal; padding: 0px

span.style: font-size: 14pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; color: #445bff
span.a: CLICK HERE TO WATCH VIDEO OF SUPERINTENDENT DR. MITCHELL PROVIDE COMMUNITY UPDATE.

div.p: The Rowland Unified School District is committed to equal opportunity for all individuals in education and in employment. Rowland Unified prohibits discrimination, harassment, intimidation, and bullying based on actual or perceived age, ancestry, color, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical information, national origin, parental status, pregnancy status, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or association with a person or a group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics. If you believe you, or your student, have been subjected to discrimination, harassment, intimidation, or bullying you should contact your school site principal and/or the District's Chief Compliance and Title IX Officer, Silvia Rivas, by phone at (626)854-8392, by email at srivas@rowlandschools.org, or in person at Rowland Unified School District at 1830 Nogales Street, Rowland Heights, 91748.
